recipe1.Name: Meat Sauce
recipe1.Description: Delicious homemade meat sauce made with ground beef (recipe designed for 8 servings)
recipe1.Directions:
1: Combine ground beef, onion, garlic, and green pepper in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until meat is browned and crumbly and vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain grease.
2: Stir diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and tomato paste into the pan. Season with oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer spaghetti sauce for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.

recipe2.Name: Mashed Potatoes
recipe2.Description: Simple and easy homemade mashed potatoes (recipe designed for 10 servings)
recipe2.Directions:
1: Place potatoes in large saucepan; add enough water to cover. Add Â¾ of the salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover loosely and boil gently for 15 to 20 minutes or until potatoes break apart easily when pierced with fork. Drain well. 
2: Return potatoes to saucepan; shake saucepan gently over low heat for 1 to 2 minutes to evaporate any excess moisture. 
 3: Mash potatoes with potato masher until no lumps remain. Add butter, pepper and remaining salt; continue mashing, gradually adding enough milk to make potatoes smooth and creamy

recipe3.Name: Chicken noodle soup
recipe3.Description: Quick and easy chicken noodle soup (recipe designed for 6 servings)
recipe3.Directions:
1: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and celery and cook until just tender, about 5 minutes. 
2: Add chicken broth, vegetable broth, chicken, egg noodles, carrots, basil, oregano, and salt/pepper (to your taste). Stir to combine and bring to a boil. 
3: Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes

recipe4.Name: Nestle Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipe4.Description: Classic Nestle chocolate chip cookies (makes about 2 dozen cookies)
recipe4.Directions:
1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. 
2: Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in small bowl. Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract in large mixer bowl until creamy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in morsels and nuts (if desired). Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. 
3: Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely
